question: An athlete runs along a circular track of diameter 80 m. The distance travelled and the magnitude of displacement of the athlete when he covers <katex>$\frac{3}{4}$</katex> of the circle is (in m)
explanation: Displacement = Chord length connecting points separated by <katex>$90^{\circ}$</katex> (since <katex>$\frac{3}{4}$</katex> of circle leaves <katex>$\frac{1}{4}$</katex> gap). <katex>$\text{Disp} = \sqrt{R^2 + R^2} = R\sqrt{2} = 40\sqrt{2}$</katex> m.
